thread.title: North Carolina billboard sparks outrage, protest
thread.title_full: North Carolina billboard sparks outrage, protest - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: North Carolina billboard sparks outrage, protest
text:
Some don't "appreciate" it.
Women are lashing out and a peaceful protest is planned after a billboard reading "Real men provide / Real women appreciate it" surfaced on a North Carolina highway recently.
"It's absolutely, absolutely insulting to single mothers, to women who have careers whether they are small careers or big careers," Winston-Salem boutique owner Molly Grace said.
The billboard on Interstate Business 40 belongs to Whiteheart Outdoor Advertising, but owner Bill Whiteheart says the organization that bought the space doesn't want to be identified.
White House revokes directive on transgender bathroom use 
A vehicle drives by the billboard on Wednesday near Greensboro, N.C. (Andrew Krech/AP) The group has leased the space for 30 days but could stay there longer.
Grace is organizing a peaceful protest on Sunday to speak out against the billboard's message, and a Facebook page for the event invites both women and men to participate.
"We are NOT protesting that the sign is capable of existing, or the people who put it up, or the ad agency, or the right to put it up," the Facebook page reads.
"We are protesting patriarchy and sexism, and that this antiquated way of thinking about women exists at all. We are protesting the implied demand that women be silent and appreciate, regardless of whatever circumstances, their role as non-providers."
Potential shooting foiled after man threatens 'non-Muslims' 
Some people have responded on the Facebook page that they don't see the billboard as offensive.
"No one really knows the real meaning of the sign and that is by design," writes one user. "You are playing right into the advertisers hands by bring them TONS of free publicity!"
Another writes, "the billboard doesn't indicate what 'real men provide' .... only that they provide 'something' in other words, they contribute. Is being in contribution a bad thing?"
With News Wire Services
